benchmark_details.name: SCoRE (Scenario-based Commonsense Reasoning Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: SCoRE is a benchmark designed to evaluate complex logical reasoning in commonsense scenarios through multi-step inference chains, synthesizing 100,000 bilingual (Chineseâ€“English) questions of varying difficulty levels and explicit reasoning chains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the long-chain commonsense reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs) and diagnose their reasoning capabilities.

data.source: The data is generated from a knowledge-based approach combining manual construction of a reliable knowledge base and automatic question generation.
data.annotation: Manually constructed knowledge base integrated with automated question generation.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct answers among the total presented questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better commonsense reasoning performance.
methodology.baseline_results: The highest-performing model achieved 69.78% accuracy on SCoRE.
